algorithm_technique: Treating the 2D grid as a 1D array and performing cyclic shifts using reversals
problem_summary_simple: Shift elements of a 2D grid k times according to specific rules.
problem_summary_technical: Simulate grid shifts by flattening to 1D, applying cyclic shift using three reversals, and reshaping.
key_insights: The shift operation can be visualized as a cyclic shift on a flattened 1D representation of the grid.
A k-shift on an m x n grid is equivalent to a (k % (m*n))-shift.
The three-reversal technique is an efficient way to perform a cyclic shift on an array in-place.
